alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued October 08 at 2:08AM AKDT until October 10 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR BRISTOL BAY... * LOCATION...Bristol Bay coast. * COASTAL FLOODING...Water level rises from 2 to 5 feet above normal highest tide line are possible. * TIMING...Water levels will rise with high tide Monday. They are expected to peak late Monday afternoon, before subsiding by the evening as winds shift more northerly. * IMPACTS...Potential for coastal erosion due to higher seas and surf with southwesterly to westerly winds. Low lying areas may also experience flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The associated low has taken a more southerly track and the strongest core of winds looks to weaken as its center moves near Cape Newenham Monday morning. As such, forecasted water levels have subsequently dropped. However, given the relatively long southwesterly fetch, high surf/coastal erosion remains possible along the Bristol Bay coast and would be most likely occur south and east of Cape Constantine.
info.instruction: A coastal flood watch means that conditions favorable for flooding are expected to develop. Coastal residents should be alert for later statements or warnings, and take action to protect property.
